input.name: oidc_well_known_endpoint
input.label: Well-known endpoint
input.help-text: This should be the well-known endpoint of the OIDC provider that returns a json with information about the provider.

input.name: retrieval_query_parameter
input.label: Query parameter
input.help-text: Specify a query parameter that the ID provider will look for when searching for tokens.

input.name: retrieval_ws_header
input.label: Sec-WebSocket-Protocol header
input.help-text: Look for a token in the Sec-WebSocket-Protocol header.

input.name: validation_allowed_subjects
input.label: Allowed clients (audience)
input.help-text: This is to restrict what clients are allowed to call services with this ID provider. Leave empty to allow all clients.

input.name: claim_username
input.label: Username claim
input.help-text: When creating users, what claim should be used for the username. If the claim is not found the ID provider will use the sub claim.

input.name: claim_displayname
input.label: User display name claim
input.help-text: When creating users, what claim should be used for the users display name. If the claim is not found the ID provider will use the sub claim.

input.name: claim_email
input.label: User email claim
input.help-text: When creating users, what claim should be used for the users email. If the claim is not found the ID provider will use the sub claim with the post-fix '@serviceaccount.enonic'.

input.name: create_users
input.label: Create new users
input.help-text: Create users when an unknown user calls the ID provider.

input.name: create_session
input.label: Create XP sessions
input.help-text: Create session in XP after token has been validated.
